text:
As other adventurers have mentioned, since ceasing operation as a capped landfill site the forest has been transformed like other sites currently ungoing regeneration in the area, allowing wildlife and numerous bird species to inhabit the forest, grasslands and scrublands and wooded hills.

A lot of potential as an outdoor recreational park and nature area.
ðŸ˜‚What a transformation! 30 years ago, this spot was a dumpster filled with trash, overwhelmed by a terrible smell and swarms of flies. It's heartwarming to see how much people appreciate it today!
A remote but beautiful piece of forest just south of Lorong Halus. Expect to get dirty and muddy if you're walking here, especially after a rainy day.
Thick forest. Another great spot for HDB to build some public housing for the people.
